content: easy-peasy no sew stay on baby booties pattern written by virginia tullock of fatcatknits © 2011 please feel free to knit for charity or to sell the booties profit or not fine with me please do not print this pattern and sell it please link back to fatcatknits com if selling booties you make with this pattern size- approximately 3-6 months yarn- worsted weight about 1 oz 28 gm these two pairs of booties weigh 3/4 oz so if you have a full oz of worsted you should be good to go needles- set of 5 us 3 3 25 mm double pointed needles gauge- i got 5 sts/in on bottom of purple bootie and 5 25 sts/in on bottom of pink bootie in stockinette gauge is not too critical babies grow quickly bottom worked back and forth cast on 9 sts purl first set up row ws sl 1 with yarn in back k 8 sts sl 1 with yarn in front p 8 sts repeat these two row until you have 10 chain selvedge sts on the right hand side of your work sl 1 with yarn in back k 8 sts this is needle 1 foot sides worked in the round pick up sts around all edges of stockinette rectangle as follows 11 sts along left side edge one st for every chain selvedge st needle 2 9 sts along bottom cast on edge needle 3 11 sts along right side edge one st for every chain selvedge st needle 4 40 sts total now working in the round purl one round knit one round repeating these two rounds twice more then purl one round again you should have 5 garter ridges top of foot worked back and forth needle 1- k 8 sts ssk last st needle 1 with first st needle 2 turn needle 1- p 8 sts p2tog last st needle 1 with first st needle 4 repeat these two row until you have 26 sts in all ending with a purl row cuff worked in the round k 1 p 1 for 8 rounds knit 1 round purl one round three times knit 1 round the bind off next round in purl you may want to use a size or two larger needle for this to prevent a tight edge
